HergÃ© himself has noted that Tintin existed as his personal expression, and although he recorded in 1947 that he knew "Tintin is no longer me, that, if he is to go on living, it will be by a sort of artificial respiration that I will have to practice constantly and which exhausts me, and will exhaust me more and more",<ref>''[http://www.paulgravett.com/articles/018_tintin_2/018_tintin_2.htm HergÃ© & Tintin: Discover a world of Tintinology]'' - [[Paul Gravett|Gravett, Paul]], originally from ''[[The Comics Journal]]'', 2003</ref> he was also fond of stating "Tintin, c'est moi!" ("Tintin, that's me!").<ref name="Farr">{{cite journal | last =Farr | first =Michael | authorlink =Michael Farr | coauthors = | year =2004 | month =March | title =Thundering Typhoons | journal =History Today | volume =54 | issue =3 | pages =62 | id = | url = | format = | accessdate = }}</ref>
HergÃ© himself has noted that Tintin existed as his personal expression, and although he recorded in 1947 that he knew "Tintin is no longer me, that, if he is to go on living, it will be by a sort of artificial respiration that I will have to practice constantly and which exhausts me, and will exhaust me more and more",<ref>''[http://www.paulgravett.com/articles/018_tintin_2/018_tintin_2.htm HergÃ© & Tintin: Discover a world of Tintinology]'' - [[Paul Gravett|Gravett, Paul]], originally from ''[[The Comics Journal]]'', 2003</ref> he was also fond of stating "Tintin, c'est moi!" ("Tintin, that's me!").<ref name="Farr">{{cite journal | last =Farr | first =Michael | authorlink =Michael Farr | coauthors = | year =2004 | month =March | title =Thundering Typhoons | journal =History Today | volume =54 | issue =3 | pages =62 | id = | url = | format = | accessdate = }}</ref>

== Snowy (''Milou'') ==<!-- This section is linked from [[The Adventures of Tintin]] -->
== Snowy (''Milou'') ==<!-- This section is linked from [[The Adventures of Tintin]] -->
â
+
[[Image:SnowyMilou.png|thumb|left|150px|A severely inebriated Snowy ''(Milou)''.]]
Snowy, a white [[Wire Fox Terrier]], is Tintin's four-legged companion who travels everywhere with him. The bond between the dog and Tintin is deeper than life, and they have saved each other from perilous situations many times.
Snowy, a white [[Wire Fox Terrier]], is Tintin's four-legged companion who travels everywhere with him. The bond between the dog and Tintin is deeper than life, and they have saved each other from perilous situations many times.
